Detailed Description

Class conduncting playing and unplaying moves.

This class maintains position presentation, contains data structures neccessary for correct moves (un)playing and provides functions performing different tasks upon position. It also contains several classes defined previously in this header file ( e.g. Ko_manager, Unplay_node_handle , ... )

Member Function Documentation

void capture_block ( Block *  block_  ) 

Captures block of stones.

Parameters:
[in] block_ Pointer to a block that is captured.

This function handles all the stuff around capturing the block. It updates actual position hash key ( by xoring out captured stones ), add liberties to adjacent blocks , updates Board_manager::playable_map and Board_manager::pot_eyes_map and safely removes the block ( by calling Board_manager::remove_block()).

bool check_atari ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_ 
)

Checks whether a move is an atari

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of played stone
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of played stone
Returns:
Returns true when a move ataris some opponent block.

Heuristic function checking whether played stone ataris some block is implemented by universal function Board_manager::check_take_liberty().

bool check_capture ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_,
bool *  connects_,
int *  stones_num_pt = NULL 
)

Checks whether a move captures something.

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of played stone
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of played stone
[out] connects_ Tells whether capturing leads to connecting unsafe stones
[out] stones_num Number of stones which were captured ( or NULL if not wanted )
Returns:
Returns true when a move captures some opponent block.

Heuristic function checking whether played stone captures some block is implemented by universal function Board_manager::check_take_liberty().

bool check_connection ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_,
bool  large_blocks_ 
)

Checks connection of two blocks of same color.

Parameters:
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of stone which creates potential connection.
[in] stone_color_ Color of stones I need to check.
[in] large_blocks_ Checks whether larger blocks are connecting this is for under the stones purposes.
Returns:
Returns true if played stone is connecting two ( larger ) blocks .

This function supports simple heuristic: connecting move is a good one.

bool check_coordinates_adjacency ( Coordinates  coordinates_1,
Coordinates  coordinates_2 
)

Checks whether given coordinates are adjacent.

Method to check whether two coordinates are adjacent.

Parameters:
[in] coordinates_1 First coordinates.
[in] coordinates_2 Second coordnates.
Returns:
Returns true when given coordinates are adjacent.

This function is useful for heuristic in statical eye analyzis ( two empty adjacent points don't create an eye ).

bool check_save_connection ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_ 
)

Checks connection of unsafe attacker block to safe attacker.

Parameters:
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of stone which creates potential connection.
[in] stone_color_ Color of stones I need to check.
Returns:
Returns true if played stone is connecting two blocks ( one of them is safe ).

This function supports simple heuristic: move connecting unsafe stones to safe is a very good one.

bool check_self_atari ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_,
int *  stones_in_atari_num_ 
)

Checks whether larger defender's group is not in atari.

Parameters:
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of stone representing the block I need to check ( if it is in atari or not ).
[in] stone_color_ Color of stones I need to check.
[out] stones_in_atari_num_ Returns how many stones are in self atari return Returns true if played stone is a self atari.

Checks whether stones at given position are in atari. This function is used as a heuristic function.

bool check_take_liberty ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_,
int  liberty_num_,
Block **  out_block_pt = NULL 
)

Important function checking whether a played move takes away liberty ( of defender or unsafe attacker ).

Multifunctional method to check whether stone removes liberty from stones of oposite color, captures or ataris.

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of played stone
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of played stone
[in] libertys_count_ Number of libertys of opposite block ( 1 == check capture , 2 == check atari , 0 == check take away liberty )
[out] out_block_pt If function returns true then this is pointer to block whose liberty might be taken.
[out] stones_num Number of stones to which liberty was taken
Returns:
Returns true when a move takes away liberty of some unsafe attacker's block.

This function supports several simple heuristic : a move taking away unsafe attacker's liberty is a good one ( liberty_num_ set to 0 ) ,capture is a good one ( liberty_num_ set to 1 ) , atari is a good one ( liberty_num_ set to 2 )

bool check_take_liberty_of_safe_attacker ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_ 
)

Checks whether a move removes safe attacker liberty.

Method checking whether stone removes liberty from attacker's safe stones.

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of played stone
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of played stone
Returns:
Returns true when a move takes away liberty of safe attacker's block.

This function supports simple heuristic : a move taking away safe attacker's liberty is a bad one.

pair< Coordinates, bool > check_takes_ko ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_ 
)

Checks whether the moves takes ko.

void Board_manager::check_under_the_stones_moves() { Block * act_block_; for ( int i = 0 ; i < B_HEIGHT; i++ ) for ( int j = 0 ; j < B_WIDTH; j++ ) { act_block_ = board[i][j].get_present_block_pt(); if ( (( act_block_ != NULL ) && ( ! act_block_->safe ) && ( act_block_->stone_color == sc_black ) && ( act_block_->liberty_count <= 2 )) || (act_block_ != NULL ) && (act_block_->stone_color == sc_white ) && ( act_block_->liberty_count <= 1 )) for ( Coordinates_set::iterator it = act_block_->liberty_set.begin() ; it != act_block_->liberty_set.end(); it++ ) playable_map.insert ( make_pair ( (*it) , Playable_data ( pp_normal ))) ;

}

};

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of potential ko taking move.
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates of potential ko taking move.
Returns:
Return's a pair < Something ( usually Coordinates ( -1 , -1 ) ) , false> if move doesn't take ko , and <Retake coordinates , true > if move does take ko

Important function to recognize whether a move takes ko. It is used in T_searcher::search for ordering ko_taking moves to the end of searched moves.

Checks whether block has some unsafe neighbour of opposite color.

Parameters:
[in] act_block_ Pointer to block whose neighbours will be checked Returns true when actual block has an unsafe neighbour of opposite color.

Supporting function for other heuristic functions.

Block * create_new_block ( Stone_color  stone_color_  ) 

Creates new empty block.

Parameters:
in[ stone_color_ Color of stones for a new block.
Returns:
Returns pointer to newly created block.

Function that creates an instance of class Block ( with no stones and liberties )

void fill_point_board (  ) 

Point_board initialization.

Initializing function, that is called in Board_manager::init_from_temp_board_manager(). It fills point board according to initial board position.

void init (  ) 

Initialization function.

This is an initialization function. It is neccessary to run it before every search in new position. It is run from Analyze_single_position() in main.cc. It clears ( and inits ) all neccessary data structures.

void init_from_temp_board_manager ( Temp_board_manager  temp_board_manager  ) 

Initialization from temp_board_manager.

Parameters:
[in] temp_board_manager This class contains all information for board initialization in simplified structures. This procedure is used to transform data stored in Temp_board_manager format ( they were gained in sgf parsing in function Sgf_parser::parse_sgf ) into Board_manager representation.
void merge_blocks ( Block *  block1_pt_,
Block *  block2_pt_ 
)

Merges two block into one.

Parameters:
[in] block1_pt_ Pointer to a first block to merge.
[in] block2_pt_ Pointer to a second block to merge.

Very important function taking care of merging two blocks of stones ( of same color ) given as a pointers. Their stones and liberties are merged and one of them ( the smaller one ) is destroyed.

bool play_a_stone ( Stone_color  stone_color_,
Coordinates  coordinates_ 
)

Plays a stone and updates data structures.

Parameters:
[in] stone_color_ Color of stone being played.
[in] coordinates_ Coordinates on which stone is played.
Returns:
Returns true if stone was successfully played ( it was a legal move ) otherwise returns true.

This is probably the most important function of position presentattion, It simulates playing a stone on the board and actualizes all related data structures. When a move is not played board_manager and also all related data structures are in same state as they were before calling the function.

void remove_block ( Block *  block_  ) 

Removes block of stones.

Parameters:
[in] block_ Pointer to a block to be removed.

Function removing the block of stones itself. It empties all stones and liberties and then destroys the block.

void unplay_last_stone (  ) 

Returns board manager to the conditions before last stone was played].

Very importatn function handling unplaying moves. It unplays last move ( the last one in a dynamic list of unplayed moves ) by actualizing Board_manager data structures to saved values.
